Reason: The configuration 'counter_write_request_timeout_in_ms' is classified as performance-sensitive. This is because the timeout value directly impacts the performance of counter write operations at the system level. Setting a lower timeout value may lead to premature timeouts and incomplete operations, affecting system performance. Conversely, setting a higher timeout value may result in longer waiting times, impacting system responsiveness. The configuration involves time-sensitive operations related to managing timeouts for counter writes, which can lead to notable performance variations.
